==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|かん|な|つき|k3=づき|yomi=k|r=y}}

===Etymology===
[[神]] (かみ, ''kami''), "god" + [[無]] (な, ''na''), meaningless [[当て字]] (''[[w:Ateji|ateji]]'') + [[月]] (つき, ''tsuki''), "month" ({{rendaku2|tsuki|zuki|sort=かんなつき'}})
: In the folk etymology, Japanese gods were said to assemble at the [[w:Izumo Taisha|Grand shrine of ''Izumo'']] (出雲大社, ''Izumo Taisha'') in the tenth month of the lunar calendar, leaving no gods in the rest of Japan.

===Pronunciation===
* {{ja-pron|かんなづき|y=k|acc=3|acc_ref=NHK}}

{{ja-noun|かんなづき}}<br/>
{{ja-noun|かみなづき}}<br/>
{{ja-noun|かむなづき}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=かんなづき}} the tenth month of the lunar calendar
# {{lb|ja|poetic|sort=かんなづき}} [[October]]
